gov.sandia.rbb
Class EventCache

java.lang.Object
  gov.sandia.rbb.EventCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
RBBEventListener
public class EventCache
extends java.lang.Object
implements RBBEventListener

The purpose of this class is to reduce repetitive, time-consuming calls to findEvents(). EventCache keeps a copy of all Events matching a specified RBBFilter that is updated in an event-driven fashion.

Events with Timeseries data are represented by a Timeseries instance and so can be used to retrieve Samples.

To do event-driven processing, see addEventListener. It will be invoked by this cache after it updates itself first, and the Event instance in the RBBEventChange will reference the instance from this cache.

Method Detail

initCache

public void initCache(RBBFilter... filters)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
This is a no-op if the args are the same as for the previous call to init.

Note: this only needs to be called to change the set of events for which findEvents will be optimized. (I.e. it doesn't need to be called just because events might have been added or removed from the RBB, for example)

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

getNumCachedEvents

public int getNumCachedEvents()
Returns the number of Events in the RBB that match the filter tags.

getEventsByID

public Event[] getEventsByID(java.lang.Long... IDs)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
This implementation of getEventsByID will ONLY include Events matching the arguments for the previous call to initEventCache. The result array will include null values for any IDs not in the cache.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

getTimeseriesByID

public Timeseries[] getTimeseriesByID(java.lang.Long... IDs)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
This will ONLY include Timeseries matching the arguments for the previous call to initCache. The result array will include null values for any IDs not in the cache, or that are not timeSeries
